73144509 Choreoathetosis DIS Admission Date : Discharge Date : 07/04/2002 ****** DISCHARGE ORDERS TLANDSTREU , SONMYRN 674-98-72-3B73 25Y-975 DISCHARGE PATIENT ON : WILL D / C ORDER BE USED AS THE D / C SUMMARY : Attending : DISPOSITION : Rehabilitation TYLENOL ( ACETAMINOPHEN ) 650 MG PO Q4H PRN headache COLACE ( DOCUSATE SODIUM ) 100 MG PO BID FOLATE ( FOLIC ACID ) 1 MG PO QD THIAMINE HCL 100 MG PO QD MVI THERAPEUTIC ( THERAPEUTIC MULTIVITAMINS ) 1 TAB PO QD ZYPREXA ( OLANZAPINE ) 5 MG PO QHS Starting Today ( 07/04 ) DIET : Follow up with Dr. Briz within 4 weeks , No Known Allergies ADMIT DIAGNOSIS : OPERATIONS AND PROCEDURES : OTHER TREATMENTS / PROCEDURES ( NOT IN O.R. ) none Patient is an 80 year old female with a history of dementia , and of a choreoathetotic movement disorder of unclear etiology . W / U for Huntington 's , ceruloplasmin , TSH , etc have all been negative in the past . Patient was admitted to neurology service . The major therapeutic change during the hospitalization was the starting of zyprexa to see if as part of its side-effect profile it would decrease the choreoathetotic movement symptoms . She still has significant myoclonic component in her arms especially with volition , but this med will certainly be continued . While essentially what we ARE hoping for in this use of the med is extra-pyramidal side effects , she should be monitored for any excessive or debilitating parkinsonian symptoms such as excessive rigidity .
